titleStmt.title: William T. Samuels to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4718

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Auditor's Office, Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS, Auditor.
EDGAR KEENON, Assistant Auditor.
James M. Withrow, Clerk.
Uberto Keenon, Clerk.
R. R. Bacon, Clerk.
John A Crittenden, Clerk.
Jno. W. Pruett, Jr., Clerk.
Charles T. Miller, Clerk
John L. Sneed.

Frankfort, March 21 1864.
Hon Tho. E. Bramlette
Govr. of Ky.
Dr Sir

P. W. Napier Sheriff of Casey Co. for the year 1860, this day paid "Balance" on Revenue for said year, with all Interest and Costs, and now prays your Excellency to be relieved from the payment of Five Hundred & Sixty 45/100 Dollars, this being the amount adjudged against him, for the nonpayment of the Revenue for said year, at the time required by law

Issue Remission of damages
Tho E Bramlette

WILLIAM T. SAMUELS,
ATTORNEY AT LAW
AND
GENERAL COLLECTING AGENT,
FRANKFORT, KY.
Special attention given to the collection of all debts confided to him in the State of Kentucky.

Franklin Cir Ct
vs
P W. Napier
Shff
$566.45
Damages
21st Mch/64
